vulnerability.title: Ensure PAM Enforces Password Requirements - Enforce for root User
vulnerability.description: The pam_pwquality module's enforce_for_root parameter controls requirements for enforcing password complexity for the root user. Enable the enforce_for_root setting in /etc/security/pwquality.conf to require the root user to use complex passwords.
vulnerability.recommendation: Remediation script: # Remediation is applicable only in certain platforms if rpm --quiet -q kernel-core && { rpm --quiet -q libpwquality; }; then if [ -e "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" ] ; then LC_ALL=C sed -i "/^\s*enforce_for_root/Id" "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" else touch "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" fi # make sure file has newline at the end sed -i -e '$a\' "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" cp "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" "/etc/security/pwquality.conf.bak" # Insert at the end of the file printf '%s\n' "enforce_for_root" >> "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" # Clean up after ourselves. rm "/etc/security/pwquality.conf.bak" else >&2 echo 'Remediation is not applicable, nothing was done' fi

triage_decision.reason: This rule is related to password complexity for the root user, which falls under the safe_to_remediate category according to the policy.

llm_verdict.message:
The vulnerability 'openscap_013' is still present in the system after applying the remediation steps. The 'scan' function returns a failure result, indicating that the vulnerability has not been fully remediated.

To resolve this, you can try to:

1. Verify that the '/etc/security/pwquality.conf' file has been modified correctly by checking its contents.
2. Check the logs to see if there are any errors or warnings related to the PAM configuration.
3. Try to manually verify that the PAM configuration is working as expected by attempting to change the password for the root user.
4. Re-run the remediation steps to ensure that the changes were applied correctly.

If none of these steps help, you may want to consider seeking additional assistance from a security expert or the OpenSCAP community.

review_feedback: The remediation script is overly complex, repeats actions, does not set the required value for enforce_for_root, and may add duplicate or commented entries, making it non‑minimal and fragile. Suggestions: Directly set enforce_for_root=1 or enforce_for_root=YES in a single sed replacement; Use a single command to ensure the line exists with correct value and uncommented; Make the operation idempotent by checking and replacing only if needed; Avoid unnecessary backup and rm steps; Add proper quoting and handle edge cases for existing commented lines
